channel.title: Trying out bad games.
channel.description: Have you ever wanted to try a game that everybody said it was bad, simply out sheer curiosity? For example, I've always wanted to play Metroid: Other M, solely to get a grip on the gameplay and see if it excuses the story (I watched the story on youtube, jesus pissing christ, it is BAD).

item.title: Trying out bad games.
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
xalener:

The only people who call it anything like “horrible” are the pretentious fucktards who were only in the series for it’s comically hamfisted noire execution. Don’t get me wrong, I loved that too, but it’s not what makes Max payne what it is. What makes Max Payne what it is, is how it handles. I’d say it’s one of the tightest third person shooters this generation, rivaling Gears of war in terms of player control. This is a fucking shooter. This is the most important factor above AI (which is above level design), and this is what it got right. I’d say it nailed all 3 factors. As linear as it was, it was a fucking great line.

Don’t make me post my 3500 word review, Xal. You’ll have a word seizure =P

As for the story, well, I’ll put it this way: There are far more pressing reasons I have for hating the game.

Read full topic

xalener:

The only people who call it anything like “horrible” are the pretentious fucktards who were only in the series for it’s comically hamfisted noire execution. Don’t get me wrong, I loved that too, but it’s not what makes Max payne what it is. What makes Max Payne what it is, is how it handles. I’d say it’s one of the tightest third person shooters this generation, rivaling Gears of war in terms of player control. This is a fucking shooter. This is the most important factor above AI (which is above level design), and this is what it got right. I’d say it nailed all 3 factors. As linear as it was, it was a fucking great line.

Ranting about what other people think about stuff and how they are idiots or assholes for not agreeing with your personal views is kind of your thing, isn’t it?

item.title: Trying out bad games.
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
k3nny1550:

I am so glad I didn’t buy Sonic 2006. Like Bahamut said, it’s fucking awful.

More recently, I got my dander up at Max Payne 3. It’s not the worst thing ever, but it sure isn’t a good sequel to Max Payne 2.

The only people who call it anything like “horrible” are the pretentious fucktards who were only in the series for it’s comically hamfisted noire execution. Don’t get me wrong, I loved that too, but it’s not what makes Max payne what it is. What makes Max Payne what it is, is how it handles. I’d say it’s one of the tightest third person shooters this generation, rivaling Gears of war in terms of player control. This is a fucking shooter. This is the most important factor above AI (which is above level design), and this is what it got right. I’d say it nailed all 3 factors. As linear as it was, it was a fucking great line.

Read full topic

k3nny1550:

I am so glad I didn’t buy Sonic 2006. Like Bahamut said, it’s fucking awful.

More recently, I got my dander up at Max Payne 3. It’s not the worst thing ever, but it sure isn’t a good sequel to Max Payne 2.

What?.. It’s best in the series IMO, the only flaw is a lack of throwable explosives.

item.title: Trying out bad games.
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
And to think I was ready to give DNF the benefit of the doubt.

It could be that I tend to prefer story to gameplay, but I couldn’t make it far into Just Cause 2. The writing and voice acting were terrible, and it made me sad.

Attaching cop cars to the street as they chased you at high speed was kinda fun, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying out bad games.
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
I saw a ton of people say DNF wasn’t that bad, and the reviews were full of shit.

I played it, and most of it was painful to sit through. There was like, one level, that was fun.

item.title: Trying out bad games.
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Nik1895:

Sonic the Hedgehog (2006) (released on PS3 and Xbox 360). Although there are many people who consider it a quite decent game.

I enjoyed the demo.

The full game, on the other hand…

talk to someone in the overworld
load for 30 seconds
they talk for 5 seconds
load for 30 seconds

That’s not an exaggeration.

Read full topic
